intro: Calcitrapa hippophaestrum, commonly known as the Mediterranean thimbleweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in terminal clusters. The plant is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has a short flowering period in spring and is known for its ability to thrive in Mediterranean climates. Calcitrapa hippophaestrum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
